string.value: To help Yulete out, I volunteered to assist him on his research. What can I do for him? I better go see #bYulete#k.

Yulete asked me to help him #bmake the Reagent#k. I'll need to pour the prepared liquid in the beaker and make the reagent, but I heard that the liquids have to be poured in sequencce. .. and the sequence is #bred, green, yellow, blue, and purple#k! Let's make this. \n\n#i4031798##t4031798# #b#c4031798##k/1
After successfully making the reagent, I reported the results to Yulete. He thanked me for helping him with something that he considered was a difficult task.

What I want you to do is help me make a reagent. Making a reagent requires precise calculations, but I've already done that for you, so all I need from you is to take care of this in a speedy manner. Can you do this?

Go to the left, and you'll see one three doors that leads to the lab. Enter the #bfirst door#k, and you'll see a beaker inside. Your job is the pour the liquid I gave you inside to make the #bcompleted reagent#k. Be care, though, you can't just put in the ingredients and expect to make a reagent.

The ingredients for the reagent that I gave you must be placed in the order of #bred, green, yellow, blue, and purple.#k. If the order's incorrect, you'll have to make the reagent all over again, so please don't forget the order! That's Red, green, yellow, blue, and purple!
As long as you watch out for the order, making the reagent shouldn't be hard. Good luck!
There must be something that's holding you back. If you have time down the road, please come see me.
Great work making the reagent. I know it must have been not easy to complete the task. Great work there. Thanks to your work, the reagent for the next experiment should be ready right away.
I don't think you've gotten me a finished reagent yet.
